node.title: Alec Baldwin calls for police on film sets to monitor gun safety
node.alt: Alec Baldwin looks pensive in this 2015 file photo.
node.description: Actor Alec Baldwin says he believes film and TV productions should hire police officers to monitor weapons on sets as Hollywood considers new safety measures following the fatal shooting of Halyna Hutchins.
node.content:
["As Hollywood considers new safety measures following the fatal shooting during filming of Western movie Rust,\u00a0actor Alec Baldwin says he believed film and TV productions should hire police officers to monitor weapons on sets.", "Baldwin accidentally shot and killed cinematographer Halyna Hutchins on October\u00a021 after being told the gun he was rehearsing with on the set in New Mexico was \"cold,\" or safe to use, according to the Santa Fe County Sheriff's Office.", "Authorities are trying to determine how a real bullet would wind up in the gun handed to Baldwin.", "Attorneys for the Rust\u00a0armorer, who oversaw weapons on the set, said she believed she had loaded it with dummy rounds\u00a0that were incapable of firing.", "", "
Halyna Hutchins\u00a0was killed on the set of the movie, Rust. Director Joel Souza was wounded in the incident.(Instagram: HalynaHutchins)
", "Since the incident, producers and crew members have been weighing whether new steps should be taken to prevent a similar tragedy in the future.", "Baldwin said he believed productions should hire police to make sure guns used in filming are safe.", "Others have called for banning real guns\u00a0from movie and TV sets.", "Actor Dwayne Johnson said last week that his future productions would only use rubber guns during filming.", "Reuters"]
